snippet: The decision to delay insurance requirements for a year was an acknowledgment of the law’s complexity, and gave officials more time to get the state exchanges right, experts said.
abstract: Obama administration's decision to delay for a year requirement that larger employers provide health insurance or pay a penalty makes operation of state exchanges more critical to success of new health care law; delay is acknowledgment of the law’s complexity, and gives officials more time to get the state exchanges right.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and KATIE THOMAS

lead_paragraph: The decision to delay insurance requirements for a year was an acknowledgment of the law’s complexity, and gave officials more time to get the state exchanges right, experts said.

headline.main: Health Law Delay Puts Exchanges in Spotlight
headline.print_headline: Health Law Delay Puts Exchanges In Spotlight

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
